g.ga: you're pulling a clip in my hair

u.a: voiceless velar plosive replaced by voiceless alveolar plosive;
voiceless velar plosive replaced by voiced bilabial plosive;
voiceless dental fricative replaced by dentalised alveolar fricative;
voiceless dental fricative replaced by voiceless labio-dental fricative;

g.ga: oh dear the tricycle's got stuck

u.a: second element of initial cluster omitted; consonant harmony;

g.ga: I want to come with you

voiceless velar plosive replaced by voiceless alveolar plosive;

voiceless labio-dental fricative replaced by voiceless alveolar fricative;
imitation after father said "Say 'come in Jenny'" . First time "Say . . ." has been understood
voiceless palato-alveolar affricate replaced by voiceless alveolar plosive;
voiced bilabial plosive replaced by voiced alveolar plosive;

g.ga: the pen's been put away for the last time
I don't want to sleep on Daddy

u.a: voiced palato-alveolar affricate replaced by voiced alveolar plosive;
voiced alveolar plosive replaced by voiced velar plosive;
voiced dental fricative replaced by voiced alveolar plosive;
imitation of "Did you go to the doctor ?"
imitation of "Jenny's never been to the doctor"
voiceless bilabial plosive inserted word initially;
voiced dental fricative replaced by voiced alveolar plosive;
after Jenny had just been hugged
requesting book with 'See-saw , Margery Daw' in it
in response to "Who's first for a kiss ?"
final consonant deletion in "nose"; second element of cluster omitted in "drops";

g.ga: I want to see it again

u.a: voiced dental fricative replaced by voiced alveolar plosive;
voiced dental fricative replaced by voiced alveolar plosive;
voiceless palato-alveolar fricative replaced by voiceless alveolar fricative;
requesting mother to stop combing her hair
voiced palato-alveolar affricate replaced by voiced alveolar plosive;
telling Mummy to eat her rice crispies
initial cluster replaced by voiced alveolar plosive;
telling mother to go to the shops to buy more when there's no jelly left
telling mother to eat some more
voiceless palato-alveolar fricative replaced by voiceless alveolar fricative;
refusing to put the lion back
cluster replaced by voiced alveolar plosive;

CHAT.comment: (1) At this stage , if asked questions like 'Where did you put it?' with falling or rising intonation , Lucy tends to imitate e.g."put it". Wh-questions or intonation are not understood. (2) The difference between voiced and voiceless plosives is still mainly one of aspiration of voiceless plosives. (3) Colour names , e.g. blue , red , pink , yellow are being used indiscriminately. (4) New situations are being carefully watched as they provoke 'creative' concatenations of syntax.
